definition: to attain perfection (idiom)
to arrive/to reach (esp. perfection)/utmost/(used in commercials)
surname Yu
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
in/at/to/from/by/than/out of
to finish/to be over/whole/complete/entire
good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect

sentences.english: China's feudal legal system came into its both perfection and decline in the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 中国封建法政体制至清代臻于完善并开始解体。

sentences.english: China's feudal legal system arrives at perfection in the Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 中国封建法政体制至明代臻于完善。

every day sees new developments (idiom)/to make constant progress
to perfect sth that is already outstanding (idiom); constantly improving
evolution/gradual forward progress
to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
diligently
to forge ahead vigorously/to dedicate oneself to progress
perfect (idiom); perfection/the best of all possible worlds/as good as it gets
lit. to get rid of the weeds and keep the flowers/to separate the wheat from the chaff (idiom)
to reach great heights (in technical skills or scholastic achievements)
to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
to blend/to integrate/to amalgamate/to fuse
diligent and tireless (idiom)
to set (sth) afoot/to initiate/beginning/origin/commencement
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
